properties.areaDesc: Curry County; South Central Highlands; Northeast Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Quay County; Chaves County Plains; Roosevelt County; Central Highlands; Eastern Lincoln County; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Estancia Valley; Harding County; Sandia/Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Southwest Chaves County; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Guadalupe County; Eastern San Miguel County; De Baca County; Union County; Far Northeast Highlands; South Central Mountains
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 2:46PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
A strong cold front is sliding south across the eastern plains of
Colorado and will progress southwest into New Mexico overnight
into Thursday. The front, combined with a disturbance moving east
across Colorado, will bring a round of snow to portions of north
central and northeast New Mexico tonight. Several inches of snow
accumulation are expected between the northern Sangre De Cristos,
Raton Pass and much of Union County, where a Winter Weather
Advisory is in effect. A mix of light snow, freezing drizzle and
freezing fog is forecast closer to Interstate 40 across the
eastern plains and the eastern highlands south to near Ruidoso
Thursday morning. Hazardous travel impacts are looking more likely
Thursday along Interstate 25 between Las Vegas and Raton, along
Interstate 40 from Tijeras to the Texas border and along US 285
from near Clines Corners south toward Roswell.

Anyone planning travel in eastern New Mexico tonight through
Thursday morning should be prepared for potential adverse weather
conditions with icy or snow-covered roads and low visibility in
fog and snow. Monitor NOAA weather radio, weather.gov/abq or your
local media for the latest weather updates. For the latest New
Mexico road conditions visit nmroads.com or call 5-1-1.

NWSheadline: A STRONG COLD FRONT COMING TO EASTERN NEW MEXICO TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY
